description: The Sundarbans are one of the last truly wild places in the world, so dense and inhospitable to humans they have been largely left alone and now harbor the world’s largest continuous population of tigers. As well as this large population of tigers the forests and waterways are also home to thousands of deer, monkeys, and dozens of species of birds and are the last stronghold for the critically endangered Gangetic river dolphin. This tour is the only tour around that caters of wildlife watchers as we charter are own boat and cruise to the heart of the Sundarbans in search of tigers and the other wildlife of this incredible place.
Things_to_Carry: (1) Windbreaker / raincoat / umbrella (2) Snicker shoes for walking. (3) Hat / Cap for Sun protection. (4) Sun-burn lotion & insects spray. (5) Binoculars (6) Camera & films (7) Toothpaste & tooth brush (8) Towels (9) Bath soap (10.) Emergency medicine. (11) Flash light.

description: The City of British captain Hiram Cox. Having the world's longest unbroken sandy sea beach (120 km) sloping gently down to the blue water of the Bay of Bengal. In Cox's Bazar have many colorful Pagodas, Buddhist Temples, Dry fish center etc. The beauty of sun setting on the rolling sea wave and moonlit night is simply captivating. All together give the aura of the fairyland a Tourist Paradise. Interesting place around Cox's Bazar Himchari, Ramu, Sonadia Island, Moheshkalil Island, Teknef, and St. Martin Island.

tour_feature.desc: Dhaka-Cox's Bazar-Dhaka by AC Volvo bus ticket
02 night 03 days double sharing accommodation at Hotel Sea Crown or kollol at Cox’s Bazar.
Breakfast at hotel Sightseeing to Himchory & Innani by open Jeep
All time take care by experienced guide during the trip (Driver come guide)
